intro: Thalictrum stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved meadow rue, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. Native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers partial shade to full sun. Its ornamental value lies in its attractive foliage and subtle floral display.
